law.catch_line: Sale of distilled spirits or wine by the drink in wet city with population of 3,000 to 7,999 -- Local option election.

text.section: In any wet city with a population equal to or greater than three thousand (3,000) but less than eight thousand (8,000) based upon the most recent federal decennial census, an election may be held in the manner prescribed in this chapter to take the sense of the people of the city as to the sale of distilled spirits or wine by the drink for consumption on the premises in the city.
An election held pursuant to this section shall be city-wide.

The sale of distilled spirits or wine by the drink shall continue as authorized in this section in any city that does not meet the population requirements contained in this section that held an election pursuant to this section and KRS 242.129 prior to January 1, 2015.

law.history: Amended 2014 Ky. Acts ch. 92, sec. 293, effective January 1, 2015. -- Amended 2013 Ky. Acts ch. 121, sec. 16, effective June 25, 2013. -- Amended 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 121, sec. 5, effective July 15, 1998. -- Created 1972 Ky. Acts ch. 96, sec. 1.
